revised_title: Lunisolar Resonances in Earth Satellite Orbits: Analyzing Semi-Major Axis, Eccentricity, and Inclination
tldr: This article discusses the effect of the Sun and the Moon on Earth satellite orbits, specifically focusing on resonant lunisolar perturbations. The author analyzes the semi-major axis, eccentricity, and inclination of satellite orbits in relation to these perturbations and derives criteria for the existence of these resonances. The article also provides tables of the predominant resonant terms for different types of lunisolar commensurabilities.
